intro: Pentarhizidium intermedium, commonly known as the intermediate pentarhizidium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rutaceae. It is native to the southern regions of South America, particularly in Chile and Argentina. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in dry, rocky habitats. The leaves are simple, alternate, and have a distinctive aromatic scent when crushed.
